column4: sorry people but I am having a heck of a time installing a "tar.bz2 package, I obviosly have not hit on the right command.  tar is  nvu-1.0-pc-linux2.6.10-gnu.tar.bz2  HELP!!!
did you get it untared yet?
martianpenguin  is right just make sure you cd to where it is
i dont think there is thats what checkinstall does (i think)
the install file will run you through the compiling process
before you start make sure you have a few things like build-essential and apt-get build-dep <packagename>
lol its not building its installing libs you need to build it
wups well what ever it is doing it is doing it well
good but you have a while to go
when thats done sudo apt-get install build-essential
and any other libs the install or readme file tells you you need
apt-get will not work on a .tar
read the INSTALL file
after your done reading the file cd into the newly created file than run ./configure --help
you might want that too
did you cd to the new file yet?
ok good now run ./configure --help let me know if stuff comes up
you didnt need the tar
you have a choice you can continue to learn to compile from source or quit while your ahead and enable universe
use synaptic and search for it in there
use pastebin
